intro: Siparuna cujabana var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf siparuna, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped, glossy dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer months. These flowers are followed by bright red, fleshy berries that are edible for birds and other wildlife. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests.
